intro: Diplachyrium, commonly known as the two-lobed fern, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed flowers and hairy stems. The leaves are typically alternate and have a serrated margin. Diplachyrium species are often found in moist, shaded environments in tropical and subtropical regions. These plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
